title: A Giant Fund Sold Disney, Celgene Stock, Bought Morgan Stanley and Oracle
text:
PGGM, one of Europe’s most influential private-equity investors, made some big changes in its investments in U.S. equities in the third quarter.

The Dutch pension giant, which managed total assets of 238 billion euros ($262 billion) as of June 30, slashed its position in Walt Disney stock (ticker: DIS) almost in half, sold its entire investment in Celgene (CELG), and bulked up stakes in Morgan Stanley (MS) and Oracle (ORCL). PGGM disclosed the trades in a form it filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

...
description: Dutch pension manager PGGM disclosed third-quarter stock trades. It nearly halved its investment in Disney and exited its position in Celgene completely.
